010package imagingbook.common.filter.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.mask.CircularMask;
014import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
017import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
018import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * Vector median filter for color images implemented by extending the {@link GenericFilterVector} class. See Sec. 15.2.2
023 * of [1] for details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
027 * (2022).
028 * </p>
029 *
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/09/10 removed debugging code
032 */
033public class VectorMedianFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
034        
035        public static class Parameters extends ScalarMedianFilter.Parameters {
036                /** Distance norm to use */
037                public NormType distanceNorm = NormType.L1;     
038        }
039        
040        private final CircularMask mask;
041        private final int maskCount;
042        private final byte[][] maskArray;
043        private final int xc, yc;
044        private final float[][] supportRegion;          // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
045        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
046        private final float[] vals = new float[3];      // check, adapt to depth
047        
048        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
049        
050        public VectorMedianFilter() {   
051                this(new Parameters());
052        }
053        
054        public VectorMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
055                this.mask = new CircularMask(params.radius);
056                this.maskCount = mask.getElementCount();
057                this.maskArray = mask.getByteArray();
058                this.xc = mask.getCenterX();
059                this.yc = mask.getCenterY();
060                this.supportRegion = new float[maskCount][3];
061                this.vNorm = params.distanceNorm.getInstance();
062        }
063        
064        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
065        
066        @Override
067        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
068                final float[] pCtr = pack.getPix(u, v);
069                getSupportRegion(pack, u, v);
070                double dCtr = aggregateDistance(pCtr); 
071                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
072                int jMin = -1;
073                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
074                        float[] p = supportRegion[j];
075                        double d = aggregateDistance(p);
076                        if (d < dMin) {
077                                jMin = j;
078                                dMin = d;
079                        }
080                }
081                float[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
082                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
083                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
084                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
085                final float[] pF = new float[3];        // the returned color tupel
086                if (dMin < dCtr) {      // modify this pixel
087                        Matrix.copyD(pmin, pF);
088                }
089                else {  // keep the original pixel value
090                        Matrix.copyD(pCtr, pF);
091                }
092                return pF;
093        }
094        
095        private void getSupportRegion(PixelPack src, int u, int v) {
096                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
097                int k = 0;
098                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
099                        int ui = u + i - xc;
100                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
101                                if (maskArray[i][j] != 0) {
102                                        int vj = v + j - yc;
103                                        src.getPix(ui, vj, vals);
104                                        Matrix.copyD(vals, supportRegion[k]);
105                                        k = k + 1;
106                                }
107                        }
108                }
109        }
110        
111        // find the color with the smallest summed distance to all others.
112        // brute force and thus slow
113        private double aggregateDistance(float[] p) {
114                double d = 0;
115                for (int i = 0; i < supportRegion.length; i++) {
116                        d = d + vNorm.distance(p, supportRegion[i]);
117                }
118                return d;
119        }
120}
